description.narrative: The project aims to create better livelihoods and gender inclusion for people working along the Development Minerals value chain in Cameroon.

activity-description.narrative: Programme focus country. ACP-EU Development Minerals Programme: Phase II

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative:
Output 1: Institutions in ACP countries have improved business enabling environment for gender-inclusive, operationalisation and formalisation of ASMEs along the Development Minerals value chain - Number of ACP countries with new or improved policies, laws, regulations to facilitate formalisation, gender inclusion and business development of ASMEs - Number of ASMEs that are formalised and/or access extension services through programme support - Number of ACP countries with geo-data maps created/ geo-data inventories conducted and experts trained in geodata collection and digitisation
Output 2: ASMEs have enhanced entrepreneurial skills and access to finance, technology, markets and market information; and better regulations - Number of ASMEs/ cooperatives/chambers/ associations trained in enterprise management and related technical skills demonstrating improved practices - Number of ASMEs that applied for / obtained small grants, credit or other financial products from financial institutions and other actors
Output 3: Public institutions, communities, women’s organisations and CSOs have strengthened capacity to put in place social and environmental safeguards in mining and quarrying of Development Minerals - Number of ASMEs/cooperatives, civil society groups, academia, regulators trained in mine and quarry management/number of selected participants who have developed return-to-work plans (RWPs) on environmental management, occupational safety and health, and gender inclusion - Number of training programmes with thematic relevance to Development Minerals developed and delivered by universities, colleges, training centres, business development consultancies, associations and other training entities - Number of ASME operators, community members, CSO staff, academia, regulators and local governments staff trained and implementing improved community engagement/conflict management and protection of human rights/labour/gender/child rights
Output 4: Women-owned ASMEs

comment.narrative:
Output 1: Institutions in ACP countries have improved business enabling environment for gender-inclusive, operationalisation and formalisation of ASMEs along the Development Minerals value chain - 8 ACP countries with new or improved policies, laws, regulations to facilitate formalisation, gender inclusion and business development of ASMEs - 4475 that are formalised and/or access extension services through programme support - 6 ACP countries with geodata maps created/geodata inventories conducted and experts trained in geodata collection and digitisation
Output 2: ASMEs have enhanced entrepreneurial skills and access to finance, technology, markets and market information; and better regulations - 1258 ASMEs/cooperatives/chambers/associations trained in enterprise management and related technical skills demonstrating improved practices - 60 ASMEs that applied for/obtained small grants credit or other financial products from financial institutions and other actors
Output 3: Public institutions, communities, women’s organisations and CSOs have strengthened capacity to put in place social and environmental safeguards in mining and quarrying of Development Minerals - 299 ASMEs/cooperatives, civil society groups, academia, regulators trained in mine and quarry management/number of selected participants who have developed return-to-work plans (RWPs) on environmental management, occupational safety and health, and gender inclusion - 42 training programmes with thematic relevance to the Development Minerals developed by universities, colleges, training centres, business development consultancies, associations, and other training entities - 94 ASME operators, community members, CSO staff, academia, regulators and local governments staff trained and implementing improved community engagement/conflict management and protection of human rights/labour/gender/child rights
Output 4: Women-owned ASMEs are supported to operate in the Development of Minerals value-chain - 153 wo

Output 1 1 ACP country with new or improved policies, laws, regulations to facilitate formalisation, gender inclusion and business development of ASMEs 185 ASMEs that are formalised and/or access extension services through programme support 1 ACP country with geo-data maps created/ geo-data inventories conducted and experts trained in geodata collection and digitisation
Output 2 200 ASMEs/ cooperatives/chambers/ associations trained in enterprise management and related technical skills demonstrating improved practices 94/53 ASMEs that applied for / obtained small grants, credit or other financial products from financial institutions and other actors
Output 3 245 ASMEs/cooperatives, civil society groups, academia, regulators trained in mine and quarry management/number of selected participants who have developed return-to-work plans (RWPs) on environmental management, occupational safety and health, and gender inclusion 7 training programs with thematic relevance to Development Minerals developed and delivered by universities, colleges, training centres, business development consultancies, associations and other training entities 60 ASME operators, community members, CSO staff, academia, regulators and local governments staff trained and implementing improved community engagement/conflict management and protection of human rights/labour/ gender/child rights
Output 4 324 women ASMEs/cooperatives/ associations receiving support in enterprise development, business management and related technical skills 67 staff of regulatory agencies, local governments, potential buyer companies and financial institutions trained in gender equality and women empowerment, with the application of these principles in the Development Minerals sector 18 government institutions and private sector companies with gender-responsive procurement policies and practices
Output 5 4 research studies conducted, including on sustainable development, climate change, disaster risk management and Development Minerals 500 stakeholders who have increased knowledge and positive attitude towards ASMEs and gender inclusion, affirmative procurement policies in Development Minerals because of South-South knowledge exchange activities organised on Development Minerals

Output 1 New policy adopted (Institutionalisation of Development Minerals Programme by upscaling of the programme at National Level by the Ministry of Mines) 37 ASMEs that are formalised and/or access extension services through programme support, with 945 beneficiaries (of which 348 women beneficiaries) 6 geo-data maps created in North, Littoral and East Regions and experts trained in geodata collection and digitisation
Output 2 37 ASMEs/ cooperatives/chambers/ associations with 945 beneficiaries (of which 348 women beneficiaries) trained in enterprise management and related technical skills demonstrating improved practices 20 ASMEs obtained small grants, credit or other financial products from financial institutions and other actors
Output 3 37 ASMEs/cooperatives, civil society groups, academia, regulators trained in mine and quarry management/number of selected participants who have developed return-to-work plans (RWPs) on environmental management, occupational safety and health, and gender inclusion One training on environmental and social impact notice,to show the importance of development that takes into account the protection of the environment (sustainable development), the objective is to master the why and how to carry out an environmental and social impact notice, definition of concepts including the environment in its different forms, the impact notice, following the actions to be carried out during the realization of the impact notice. No ASME operators, community members, CSO staff, academia, regulators and local governments staff trained and implementing improved community engagement/conflict management and protection of human rights/labour/gender/child rights
Output 4 250 women ASMEs/cooperatives/ associations receiving support in enterprise development, business management and related technical skills No staff of regulatory agencies, local governments, potential buyer companies and financial institutions trained in gender equality and women empowerment, with the application of these principles in the Development Minerals sector No government institutions and private sector companies with gender-responsive procurement policies and practices
Output 5 TOR developed to conduct a study on the green mining initiative. 222 stakeholders who have increased knowledge and positive attitude towards ASMEs and gender inclusion, affirmative procurement policies in Development Minerals

Output 1 Strategy on formalization and business acceleration was prepared 55 (18 from phase I and 37 from phase II) ASMEs that are formalised and/or access extension services through programme support, with more than 695 participants, of which 348 are women. 13 geo-data maps created/ geo-data inventories conducted and experts trained in geodata collection and digitisation
Output 2 37 ASMEs/ cooperatives/chambers/ associations trained in enterprise management and related technical skills demonstrating improved practices (Partnered with the University of Tschang to provide business incubation services to ASMEs. 21 of them formed into companies) 4 ASMEs that applied for / obtained small grants, credit or other financial products from financial institutions and other actors
Output 3 37 ASMEs/cooperatives, civil society groups, academia, regulators were trained in all aspects – business, mine/ quarry management, value chain, market analysis, environment, health and safety, gender mainstreaming and regulation 37 participants developed return-to-work plans (RWPs) on business, mine/ quarry management, value chain, market analysis, environment, health and safety, gender mainstreaming and regulation 4 training programs with thematic relevance to Development Minerals developed and delivered by universities, colleges, training centres, business development consultancies, associations and other training entities: 1. Training on the value addition for clay, dimension stone, sand and aggregates, with various steps: the extraction, processing, transportation, marketing and consumption, 2. Market Analysis : The importance of conducting a market analysis, the steps, the global market, the target market and sales forecasts, territory targeted, target clientele and customer groups, competitors, description of the products and obstacles to carrying out a market study 3. Simplified Accounting 4. Environmental, health and safety
55 ASME (18 from phase I and 37 from phase II) operators, community members, CSO staff, academia, regulators and local governments staff trained and implementing improved community engagement/conflict management and protection of human rights/labour/gender/child rights
Output 4 4 women ASMEs/cooperatives/ associations receiving support in enterprise development, business management and related technical skills 55 (18 from phase I and 37 from phase II) people trained in gender equality and women empowerment, with the application of these principles in the Development Minerals sector No government institutions and private sector companies with gender-responsive procurement policies and practices
Output 5 Analysis of ASM in the development minerals sector and the impact of COVID-19 on them was conducted 250 stakeholders increased knowledge and positive attitude towards ASMEs and gender inclusion, who attended the exhibition made in Cameroon, we have presented our knowledge on: - Transformation of clay and lateritic materials for the manufacture of fine pottery-ceramic products and stabilized earth bricks. - Unit for the valorization of cut stones in the locality of Saa for the manufacture of tiles, pavers and cladding stones - Production and marketing unit for standardized gravel and ashlars - Manufacture of cut stone and storage of rubble in Mogodi Maroua1st
